Object.Name: Electrical monitor
Object.Description1: The uCIFI electrical monitor object provides attributes related to the analysis of electrical consumption in an outdoor luminaire or in a streetlight cabinet. It also identifies electrical anomalies.

Item.Name: Supply voltage
Item.Description: Electrical voltage supplied to the device.

Item.Name: Supply current
Item.Description: Electrical current supplied to the device.

Item.Name: Frequency
Item.Description: Frequency of the supply current to the device.

Item.Name: Active power
Item.Description: Active power consumed by the device and its electrical load.

Item.Name: Power factor
Item.Description: Power factor is equal to active power divided by apparent power. The value is between -1 and +1.

Item.Name: Cumulated active energy
Item.Description: Cumulated number of kWh measured by the device and its load since last energy counter reset.

Item.Name: Energy reset
Item.Description: Reset both cumulated active and reactive energy counter.

Item.Name: Low power factor threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power factor event.

Item.Name: Low power factor
Item.Description: Set to True if the power factor is below threshold. This is an absolute value threshold.

Item.Name: Low power threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power event.

Item.Name: Low power threshold at low dim level
Item.Description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power event. This is an addition to the low power threshold to allow a separated threshold when dim level is low.

Item.Name: Low power
Item.Description: Set to True if the power is below threshold. Vendor may consider the Low power threshold at low dim level to set this resource to True, taking into account the lamp dim level.

Item.Name: High power threshold
Item.Description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high power event.

Item.Name: High power threshold at low dim level
Item.Description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high power event. This is an addition to the high power threshold to allow a separated threshold when dim level is low.

Item.Name: High power
Item.Description: Set to True if the power is above threshold. Vendor may consider the High power threshold at low dim level to set this resource to True, taking into account the lamp dim level.

Item.Name: Low current threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low current event.

Item.Name: Low current
Item.Description: Set to True if the current is below threshold.

Item.Name: High current threshold
Item.Description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high current event.

Item.Name: High current
Item.Description: Set to True if the current is above threshold.

Item.Name: Low voltage threshold
Item.Description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low voltage event.

Item.Name: Low voltage
Item.Description: Set to True if the voltage is below threshold.

Item.Name: High voltage threshold
Item.Description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high voltage event.

Item.Name: High voltage
Item.Description: Set to True if the voltage is above threshold.

Item.Name: Critical inrush threshold
Item.Description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a critical inrush event.

Item.Name: Critical inrush current
Item.Description: Set to True if the inrush current is above threshold.

Item.Name: Minimum inrush Current
Item.Description: Minimum inrush current since last configuration.

Item.Name: Maximum inrush Current
Item.Description: Maximum inrush current since last configuration.

Item.Name: Latest inrush Current
Item.Description: Latest inrush current measured since last time the relay switched ON.

Item.Name: Reactive power
Item.Description: Instantaneous reactive power measured by the device and its electrical load.

Item.Name: Reactive energy
Item.Description: Cumulative reactive power measured by the device and its electrical load since last energy counter reset.
